description: Equalizer filter type defining the frequency response characteristic. Each filter type has different slope characteristics and use cases for audio processing.

oneOf.description: Parametric bell filter - symmetric boost/cut around center frequency with adjustable Q
Low-pass filter with 6 dB/octave slope - gentle treble rolloff
Low-pass filter with 12 dB/octave slope - steeper treble rolloff
High-pass filter with 6 dB/octave slope - gentle bass rolloff
High-pass filter with 12 dB/octave slope - steeper bass rolloff
Low shelf filter - boost/cut all frequencies below the corner frequency
Low shelf filter with Q control - adjustable transition steepness
Low shelf filter with 6 dB/octave slope
Low shelf filter with 12 dB/octave slope
High shelf filter - boost/cut all frequencies above the corner frequency
High shelf filter with 6 dB/octave slope
High shelf filter with Q control - adjustable transition steepness
High shelf filter with 12 dB/octave slope
All-pass filter (1st order) - phase shift without magnitude change
All-pass filter (2nd order) - phase shift without magnitude change
Band-pass filter - passes frequencies within a band, attenuates outside
Notch filter - attenuates frequencies in a narrow band (opposite of parametric)
Tilt filter - simultaneous shelf boost at one end and cut at the other

title: EqualizerType
